title: Scientific societies
text:

International Association for Applied Mathematics and Mechanics (GAMM)

Society of Engineering Science (SES)

   Europe

France InterPore Chapter (FIC)

title: Git
text:
Git is a useful version control manager.
Pro Git is the ultimate git reference.
A tutorial made at INRIA: https://tutorial.gitlabpages.inria.fr/git
To learn git, there are also multiple games:

https://learngitbranching.js.org
https://ohmygit.org

title: Shell
text:
Games
Check out https://www.learnshell.org to learn online!


Navigation

pwd: Print the current working directory.
ls: List files and directories in the current directory.

ls -a: Show hidden files.
ls -l: Detailed list view.

cd [path]: Change directory.

cd ..: Go up one directory level.
cd ~: Go to the home directory.




File and Directory Operations

touch [file]: Create a new empty file.
mkdir [directory]: Create a new directory.
cp [source] [destination]: Copy files or directories.

cp -r [directory] [destination]: Copy directories recursively.

mv [source] [destination]: Move or rename files/directories.
rm [file]: Delete a file.

rm -r [directory]: Delete a directory and its contents.

rsync [options] [source] [destination]: Synchronize files/directories over ssh.

rsync -av [source] [destination]: Archive mode (preserves permissions, timestamps) with verbose output.
rsync -az [source] [destination]: Compress data during transfer.
rsync --progress [source] [destination]: Show progress during synchronization.




Viewing File Contents

cat [file]: Display the entire content of a file.
vim [file]: Open the file in vim text editor



Permissions

chmod [permissions] [file]: Change file permissions.

Example: chmod 755 script.sh.

chown [user]:[group] [file]: Change file owner.



Searching and Finding

find [path] -name [pattern]: Search for files by name.
grep [pattern] [file]: Search for a pattern in a file.

grep -r [pattern] [directory]: Search recursively.




Networking

ping [hostname]: Check connectivity to a host.
curl [url]: Fetch data from a URL.



Miscellaneous

echo [text]: Print text to the terminal.
history: Show command history.
clear: Clear the terminal screen.



bash/zsh configuration

zsh bindkey \^U backward-kill-line add this to .zshrc to bring back bash command Ctrl+U

Deletes all text on the current command line from the cursor position to the beginning of the line

navigating through history using substring searches:

zsh bindkey "^[[B" history-substring-search-down
zsh bindkey "^[[A" history-substring-search-up
bash “[B”: history-search-forward
bash “[A”: history-search-backward

title: Welcome to the UFR Meca Palaiseau’s wiki’
text:
Just open the corresponding markdown file in the GitHub, modify it however you want and commit the changes, that’s it!



Add the resource (pdf, svg, etc.) in the Resources/Documents/YourSubfolderOfChoice folder and reference it in markdown using, [text](Resources/Documents/YourSubfolderOfChoice/YourFile), then commit the changes, done!

title: Welcome to the UFR Meca Palaiseau’s wiki’
text:
Just open the corresponding markdown file in the GitHub, modify it however you want and commit the changes, that’s it!

title: VS Code
text:
Microsoft Visual Studio Code is a nice text (and much more!) editor.

Installation
To install it on your machine, you can either download from https://code.visualstudio.com, or use HomeBrew:
brew install visual-studio-code


Sync
You can sync preferences across machines by signing in with your GitHub (also owned by Microsoft…) account.


Plugins
Thanks to plugins, you can use it for many things:

Coding

Python
GitLens
GitHub Actions
GitLab Workflow
Remote - SSH

LaTeX

LaTeX Workshop
Code Spell Checker
Citation Picker for Zotero

Jupyter

Jupyter

Quarto

Quarto

title: Writing
text:
The package microtype helps improving the rendering of long text easily
Quarto is an open-source library that enables to create dynamic scientific documents, presentations, and websites using Markdown, LaTeX, and a variety of programming languages (including python, R, etc.).
Good practices regarding figure formating

Colour science (Crameri, Shephard, and Heron 2020) and colour map choices
10 rules for better figures in scientific writting (Rougier, Droettboom, and Bourne 2014)
Nice tool for plotting data in latex: PGFplot






This PhD template is for writting a PhD thesis with a separate title page. It aims at setting up all the necessary packages and create the base outline of a thesis.
This quarto template is for presentations with an ENSTA style.

title: Zotero
text:
Zotero is a nice open-source software to manage bibliography.

Misc options (Preferences -> Advanced -> Config Editor)

I usually set intl.locale.requested to en-GB (otherwise the dates are in the horrendous en-US format)
I also set extensions.zotero.recursiveCollections to true



BibTeX export
The BetterBibTeX plugin allows to export your library in bibtex or biblatex format. If you choose “Keep updated” it will update the bib file every time you modify your library.
BetterBibTeX preferences:

Citation key formula = auth+year+journal.abbr.alphanum
If both DOI & URL, export DOI only
Fields to omit from export: extra, issn, isbn, timestamp, file, eprinttype, eprint, keywords, month, language, abstract, urldate, urlmonth, annotation, langid
